about.title: About This Memorial
about.missionText: This memorial exists to document and preserve the memory of every person killed by the Islamic Republic of Iran since 1979. Every victim was a human being with dreams, loved ones, and a story that deserves to be told.
about.whyText: Since its founding in 1979, the Islamic Republic of Iran has systematically persecuted and killed dissidents, ethnic and religious minorities, women, students, and ordinary citizens. From the mass executions of the 1980s to the chain murders of the 1990s, from the 2019 crackdown to the 2022 protests — victims are often forgotten, their stories left untold. This memorial puts an end to that silence.
about.dataSourcesText: Our data comes from multiple trusted sources and is continuously expanded:
about.methodologyText: Every entry goes through a verification process. We cross-reference information against at least two independent sources, including reports from human rights organizations, news agencies, witness testimonies, and court documents. Entries are marked as verified, unverified, or disputed.
about.openSourceText: This project is open source and community-driven. Anyone can contribute by submitting information about victims, correcting existing entries, or helping with translations.
about.howToHelpSubmit: Submit information about victims — every name, every detail matters
about.howToHelpTranslate: Help translate content into Farsi, English, or German
about.howToHelpDev: Contribute to the open-source project as a developer
about.howToHelpShare: Share the project so more people learn about it
about.privacyText: We treat the data of victims and their families with the utmost respect. Submitted information is reviewed before publication. The identity of contributors is never disclosed. We document facts, not opinions.
about.quote: "As long as we remember, they live on."

footer.remembrance: So that no one is forgotten.
